text: King's Bridge pictured in 2007 King's Bridge is a road bridge in Stranmillis, south Belfast. The first concrete road bridge in Ireland, it opened in 1910. The bridge forms part of a one-way system along with the neighbouring Governor's Bridge. Together they connect the Stranmillis and Annadale Embankments, with King's Bridge carrying traffic from the former to the latter. ==References== Category:Bridges in Northern Ireland Category:Buildings and structures in Belfast Category:Bridges completed in 1910
title: King's Bridge, Belfast
